result.execSummary:
The defendant Calib I Steinbach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14(2).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling or combination of the two, otherwise 9 hours community service per week.

Assessment, treatment, counseling deemed appropriate by agent. 

AODA and follow through. 

DNA sample. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Re: Order for Payment and Reimbursement to County
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Amanda. 
Case called at 10:13 am. 
State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck.  Defendant appears, and with Attorney Dan Cveykus.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

State moves to: 
Ct.1(Child Abuse - Intentionally Cause Harm)>>DRI.
Ct.4(DC/Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct.5(DC/Repeater)>>DRI.

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA to:
Ct.2(Criminal Trespass to Dwelling/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
Ct.3(Criminal Damage to Property/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 1 year probation, to run concurrent; CONDITIONS: 10 days MCJ, no objection to EMP..  Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two, otherwise 9 hours community service. Maintain absolute sobriety. AODA and follow through.  Pay CC/DNA surcharge and provide sample. 

COURT grants 24 days credit. 
Adj: 10:22 am.
Plea hearing on August 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADA Hannah Boeck appears in person; Attorney Cveykus appears in person; Defendant excused
DATES: 
PLEA set w/Judge O'Neill: 8/16/22 at 10:00 am
Wavier of No Contact B.C.
Pre-trial conference on August 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Signed at MCJ on 06/10/22
Bail/bond hearing on July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck; Attorney Daniel Cveykus appears in person; Defendant in custody; excused
Motion to Modify Bond set: July 6 at 8:30 am via ZOOM

AMENDED to $2500 signature bond so Defendant can go to treatment. Once Defendant returns from treatment, bond is to be converted back to original cash bond.

No contact with victim(s): K.M., B.L.C., B.J.R. or residence/place of work. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. No contact with minor children without adult supervision.   No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.   Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.   Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol and controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.     Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Case Called: 9:02 a.m. 
Clerk Heather.
State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck; Defendant appears from MCJ, w/Attorney Dan Cveykus;
Date and time set for a bond modification hearing.
VRCW.

Atty Cveykus notes Deft is on a probation hold, bond mod is not going to allow him to be released, but the bond mod will allow Deft to go to treatment once a bed is available.
ADA Boeck states objections to cash bond, but does not object to Deft getting treatment. Recommends bond be amended for Deft to go to treatment, and then converting bond back to cash after treatment is complete.
Atty Cveykus wishes his client continues outpatient treatment, and requests a bond that will allow him to be released, notes Deft will still be on probation.
COURT addresses parties. 
COURT amends bond to a $2500.00 signature bond, and once Deft returns from treatment, bond converts back to original cash bond. 
- Same conditions.


Adjourned: 9:11 a.m.
